item.title: The Alice Gross case: Examining EU law implications of allowing murderers to freely move within the EU.
item.description:
Steve Peers British readers of this blog are likely aware of the case of missing teenager Alice Gross. A Latvian man, Arnis Zalkalns, is a person of interest in her disappearance. What makes this case more complex is that Mr. Zalkalns had a prior murder conviction in Latvia before relocating to the UK. He has since vanished, possibly returning to Latvia. This raises several questions: how was a convicted murderer able to enter the UK undetected?..
